Symposium Dynamica

For the annual Symposium Dynamica edition, I was mandated to produce the posters.

XII edition
This is the three chosen posters. The butterfly represents the butterfly effect (a small perturbation can have large consequences), well-known in chaos studies. I also used the Lorentz and Rosner attractors for a more classic version.

IV Symposium Numerica
Symposium Numerica is an event where students present their final projects on numerical analysis.

Traveling salesman problem
In this edition, my coworker and I developed an iOS app for the students. In this app, the students are asked to connect the dots in order to have the shortest path. Then, the data were compared to the solutions obtained using optimization algorithms (Tabou, Genetic, Firefly, Random).
